results.title: Spellbound (2002)
results.creator_credit: Jeffrey Blitz, Sean Welch, Home Box Office and Thinkfilm
results.brief_description: This Academy Award nominated documentary focuses on eight children competing in a championship spelling bee. We see behind the scenes meeting the finalists and their families. The tension of the competition is gripping as is looking into the varying backgrounds of the contestants. The high pressure world of the spelling bee and the pressure placed on the contestants can cause a sweat in not only the contestant and their parents but also the viewer. Gruelling competition and high drama are found in this compelling documentary. Having the background knowledge on the competitors adds to the overall enjoyment. Notable is the fact that the winners in most cases are from ethnic backgrounds who are willing to work hard and succeed. There is certainly a great deal of face pulling and mental strain in this moving and exciting film.

results.title: Speaking of animals
results.creator_credit: Jerry Fairbanks and Jerry Fairbanks Productions
results.brief_description: A selection of short films and excerpts from the forties that apply visual effects to live action footage of animals so they appear to be talking and singing. While some segments are mildly amusing, the ones that feature monkeys performing humiliating tricks are less so. “Who’s who in animal land” and “And their families” won Academy Awards for Best Short Feature.

results.title: Japan: a banquet menu
results.creator_credit: Hal Weiner, Marilyn Weiner and Screenscope
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World of Cooking”.
Shows chef Nobuo Iida and his assistants preparing and presenting a traditional Japanese banquet. Highlights the importance of custom and ritual in Japanese cooking.

results.title: Speaking object-ly
results.creator_credit: Don White, George Johnson, John Taylor, National Film Board of Canada and Yaletown Productions Inc.
results.brief_description: This film explores the concept that inanimate objects such as barber poles, candy wrappers, clothing and furniture can communicate complex and subtle messages about people and things. As images of familiar objects are presented, a rhythmic country-rock song raises questions about the messages they carry. The viewer is encouraged to think about how objects stimulate our associations in order to communicate an idea or manipulate our responses. Images by John Seale.

results.title: India: a northern menu
results.creator_credit: Hal Weiner, Marilyn Weiner and Screenscope
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World of Cooking”.
Just as India is a rich blend of cultures, Indian cooking is a blend of exotic spices. Chef Simon Fernandes and his assistants unveil some aspects of their ancient cuisine.

results.title: Speaking in Public (I'd Rather Be in Siberia)
results.creator_credit: Mike Barnacoat and University of Technology, Sydney. Dept. of Production Services
results.brief_description: The first part of this program, presented by Mike Minehan, provides you with an overview of the skills you will need to become a successful presenter - preparation, posture, gesture, facial expression, eye contact, language, vocal skills and energy level. The second part of the program shows a highly skilled public speaker, Father Peter McGrath, giving a lecture to nursing students.

results.title: Holland: a traditional menu
results.creator_credit: Hal Weiner, Marilyn Weiner and Screenscope
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World of Cooking”.
Generations ago, a harsh climate and back-breaking farmwork inspired Dutch cooks to develop hearty, nutritious dishes. Much of the hardship has subsided, but the traditional foods are still a favourite with the Dutch. Chef Hans Clemens prepares one mouth-watering meal.

results.title: Advanced panel beating and paint work
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Panel & paint”.
Provides instructions for the serious amateur panel beater. Demonstrates advanced techniques beyond basic repairs including correct methods for replacing door skins and quarter panels and windscreen fitting. Outlines two pack paint application discussing mixing, spray equipment and safety concerns. Features John Llewellyn.
